In Machine Learning, you are working on the K-Means clustering algorithm. Which of the following statements about the Mini Batch K-Means are correct:

Statements

  1. It is a variant of the K-Means algorithm which uses mini-batches to reduce the computation time, while still attempting to optimize the same objective function.

  2. Mini-batches are subsets of the input data, randomly sampled in each training iteration. 

  3. These mini-batches increase the amount of computation required to converge to a local solution.

In Machine Learning, you are working on various clustering algorithms. If you are required to implement a K-Means clustering algorithm, then which of the following sequences of steps must be followed to perform this action:

Steps

  1. Assign each observation to the cluster whose centroid is closest by using the Euclidean distance
  2. For each of the K clusters, compute the cluster centroid. The kth cluster centroid is the vector of the p feature means for the observations in the kth cluster.
  3. Randomly assign a number, from 1 to K, to each of the observations.

You are given K clusters (C1…..CK) that denote sets containing the indices of the observations in each cluster. If you are required to perform a K-Means clustering algorithm on these clusters, then which of the following properties must be satisfied in this scenario:

Properties

  1. C 1 ∩ C 2 ∩ . . . ∩ C K = {1, . . . , n}
  2. C k ∩ C k’  = ∅ for all k  = k’
  3. C 1 ∪ C 2 ∪ . . . ∪ C K = {1, . . . , n}
  4. C k ∪ C k’  = ∅ for all k  = k’

Alice is working on the following dataset. Bob has asked her to pick 3 and 15 from the given dataset and asked her to implement two clusters from the dataset. If she is required to implement K-Means clustering algorithm to perform this action, then determine those two clusters in this scenario:

Dataset

{1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 9, 10, 11, 15, 20, 28, 30}

Clusters:

  1. {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 9} and {10, 11, 15, 20, 28, 30}
  2. {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8} and {9, 10, 11, 15, 20, 28, 30}
  3. {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 9, 10, 11} and {15, 20, 28, 30}
  4. {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 9, 10, 11, 15} and {20, 28, 30}
